intro: Teline salsoloides, commonly known as the saltbush, is a flowering plant native to arid and saline environments. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant is adapted to withstand high salinity and drought conditions, making it a common species in coastal and desert regions. Its root system helps stabilize sandy soils, and it often forms dense stands in disturbed areas. Teline salsoloides plays a role in preventing soil erosion and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
